(Use any of the "gifts" from arelith that you want)
Thanks for your time

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I would change something in these builds. Since you're not going for Epic Dodge, you can go Barbarian 16 / Rogue 4 pre-epic and leave only one Barbarian level to be taken in epics for +1 AB at the cost of some skill points ( you can move your first 3 Rogue levels to lvls 6, 7 and 8 and take the other one at 17, ensuring 2 skill dumps pre-epic, which should be enough to get you by).

The rest I'll have to look at later on.

@ Skaghunter: Bulding a Wizard for Arelith is a bit hard because there are many spell changes and custom modifications. It should be done by someone who knows the specifics. I don't, so I can't help much.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
He wanted a scimitar, which is not finessable, so the charaacter had to be STR-based. Less-frequent skill dumps would mean that your skills fall behind. Imagine being a level 16 charactyer with the skills of a level 8 Rogue. You would not be able to disarm any traps or open any locks because your skills would be too low. Maximizing level-30 power wouold make the build less fun to play while you're leveling, and the difference in AB would be only 1. That said, I see a tweak I could do: make it Rogue 10 / Barbarian 20 for more Barbarian goodies.

Skaghunter, I'll make new versions of these builds, but I don't want to make 4 more builds, so which 2 do you want?
(1) Both tweaked and maximized Half-Orc builds?
(2) Both tweaked and maximized Human builds?
(3) Tweaked versions for both races?
(4) Maximized versions for both races?
